name: 梁曉帆
objective: This course focuses on the design and evaluation of interactive systems from a human centered perspective. Students will learn about the theories and models of human cognitive processing with the consideration of task and enviroment characteristics; and students will learn how to apply design processes and evaluation techniques for improving system performance.
schedule:
Week 1-2: What is human-computer interaction?
Week 3-8: What is human information processing?
Week 9-12: What is the context of use?
Week 13-16: How to design, analyze, and evaluate an interactive system?
Week 17-18: Final report and presentation
scorePolicy: Reading & Presentation (20%), Projects (25%x2), Final Report & Presentation (30%)
materials:
1. Interaction design: Beyond human-computer interaction, Preece et al., 2002, Wiley.
2. Engineering psychology and human performance, 3rd. Eds., Wickens and Hollands, 2002, Prentice Hall.
3. Human-computer interaction, 3rd. Eds., Dix et al., 2004, Pearson.
